Description: Floor sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery plate; interior: in tondo, black-figure Gorgoneion (hair, ear in added red and snake preserved); band of two rows of staggered dots between pairs of brown bands around; in outer frieze, part of a lotus (red on heart, outer leaves, alternate inner leaves) and palmette (red on heart and alternate petals) cross (red on link) and part of lion to left, head looking back; red on mane; underside reserved.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vessel as British Museum 1888,0601.579, Oxford AN1896-1908-G.128.1, AN1896-1908-G.128.8 and Toronto 910x234.43. The sherd is also published in Callipolitis-Feytmans, D., Les Plats attiques à figures noires. Paris 1974, 309, pl. 15, no. 4.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.25)
Beazley & Payne 1929 / Attic Black Figured Fragments from Naukratis (p. 255, no. 6)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 350, no. B439)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 223, no. 1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0796) (Phase 1)
